title: Panel, 1775–1800
medium:
Medium: silk on silk, metallic thread
Technique: embroidered on twill weave
creditline: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Long, narrow shaped panel, probably from a skirt, that is narrower at the top and curved at the bottom. Cream-white twill weave with brocading in a small floral design. Embroidered in multicolored silks, metallic threads and paillettes. Narrow borders and festoons of flowers extend across the panel, each caught with a ribbon and tassels in metallic thread.

tombstone.epitaph:
Panel, 1775–1800.
1775–1800. Medium: silk on silk, metallic thread
Technique: embroidered on twill weave. Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1950-121-63.
